newsitem.title: HUNGARY: FORINT RETURNS TO NBH BID, BCE ECU FUTURES ACTIVE.
newsitem.headline: FORINT RETURNS TO NBH BID, BCE ECU FUTURES ACTIVE.

text.p: Foreign currency selling brought the forint back to the central bank bid in the afternoon session of the Hungarian interbank forex market, dealers said on Wednesday.
"Although there were no dramatic events, large amounts of foreign currency were on offer," said Ervin Csengeri of Inter-Europa Bank.
The forint, helped by the firming mark, closed stronger at 150.75/80 to the U.S. unit, compared with its opening of 150.95/151.05.
The forint floats against the central bank's currency basket made up 70 percent of the Ecu and 30 percent of the dollar.
On the Budapest Commodity Exchange, Ecu futures accounted for three quarters of the relatively low 417 million forints turnover.
Japanese yen contracts were the main movers, dropping for five maturities, while other currency futures ended mostly steady.
